text: Henri Poupart-Lafarge (born 10 April 1969, in Nancy) is a French business executive and the current CEO of Alstom, a post he has occupied since February 2016. After acquiring degrees from École Polytechnique, École des ponts ParisTech, and MIT, he went to work for the World Bank. In 1994, he joined the French Ministry for the Economy and Finance, and by 1998, he was Alstom's Head of Investor Relations. He then became the Vice President of Distribution Finance. Before becoming CEO of Alstom, he was successively CFO of Alstom and President of two sectors of the Alstom Group, Alstom Grid during one year, then Alstom Transport during five years.Alstom - Henri Poupart-Lafarge alstom.com, reviewed 28 September 2017 ==References== Category:1969 births Category:Living people Category:French chief executives Category:École Polytechnique alumni Category:École des Ponts ParisTech alumni Category:Corps des ponts Category:People from Nancy, France Category:Alstom
